Class ScrollingWorld

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.World
      ScrollingWorld

public abstract class ScrollingWorld
extends greenfoot.World

This world contains the main part of the scrolling system. Here you can also limit the world by changing the variables WORLD_WIDTH and WORLD_HEIGHT using the constructor of the class (see ExampleWorld). You can create scrolling worlds in every screen size (the size of the frame) and every scrolling size (the real size of the world). The GreenfootImage textur is the background image that is used for the scrolling background. You can use any image you want instead of this. You just have to call the method setScrollingBackground in the constructor of your scrolling world (see ExampleWorld) with the GreenfootImage you want to use for the background. The scenario will automaticly create a example world. You can delete this world and use another subclass of this world if you want to use the scrolling system in your scenario. You shouldn't change the code of this class because that will probably cause problems in the scrolling system.

Method Detail

createTextur

protected final void createTextur()
Creates a moving textur on the background image of the world.

getScrollingHeight

public int getScrollingHeight()
Returns the height of to scrolling world. (0 => infinite).

Returns:
The height of the scrolling system. If 0 is returned the world height is infinite.

getScrollingWidth

public int getScrollingWidth()
Returns the width of to scrolling world. (0 => infinite).

Returns:
The width of the scrolling system. If 0 is returned the world width is infinite.

getTotalXMovement

public int getTotalXMovement()
Get the total movement in x direction.

Returns:
The total movement in x direction the scrolling actor has covered.

getTotalYMovement

public int getTotalYMovement()
Get the total movement in y direction.

Returns:
The total movement in y direction the scrolling actor has covered.

removeAllObjects

public void removeAllObjects()
Remove all objects that currently are in the world.

removeAllObjectsBut

public void removeAllObjectsBut(greenfoot.Actor actor)
Remove all objects that currently are in the world with the exception of the actor given as parameter.

Parameters:
actor - The only object that will not be removed from the world.

resetPlayersPosition

public final void resetPlayersPosition(ScrollingActor scrollingActor)
Reset the position of the ScrollingActor and set the position of all other objects in the world.

setScrollingBackground

public void setScrollingBackground(greenfoot.GreenfootImage bgImage)
Change the background image of the scrolling world to the given image.

Parameters:
bgImage - The new background image.
